Not a fan of seeing animals suffocate.  I realize this is a perfectly normal part of life, but I think too many people gloss right over what it means for a fish.  Fish behavior indicates that they feel pain (including the fact that a painkiller stops the behavior, even though the trauma remains).  Please consider that getting hauled out of the water on a hook and being deprived of oxygen really sucks.  Yes, all sorts of animals do this; just be sure you want to be one of them.

funny vid,,,your comparison to a gun would be more accurate to say the "safety" of a gun trigger,(this is bionics, imitating natures machinery for ourselves),I have caught Triggers by hand when they lodge themselves into a crevice and use the main dorsal spine to lock themselves in by reaching around to the trigger and releasing it.  Filefish also have a "trigger" spine,, and these fish will bite very hard even in a fish bucket if your not careful
